36179812.review: Redirection is a fun puzzle game on its own, but it is incredibly short. Fortunately, there is modding and Steam Workshop support. While short, I found that the main game was pretty fun. If you end up really liking it, you can play other people's puzzles. Also, with that modding thing, you can also make custom DOS-esque programs for the game's Robot Arcade feature. Someone made a music tracker with it, which is cool. Anyway, I think the main enjoyment of this game will come from 100%-ing it or modding / playing mods of it, should you happen to pick it up yourself. Do you like puzzles and modding? Then get this game.

30086126.review:
[h1] Redirection – милая и не тяжелая головоломка [/h1]

Redirection была разработана Даниэлем Ратклиффом на движке Unity. В Steam’e игра вышла 24 октября 2016 года. Игра в магазине Steam стоит всего 5.59$. 

[list]

[*] Игра представляет из себя головоломку в реальном времени. У игрока есть время на расстановление преград и времени через которое оно активируется. Смысл игры заключаеться в транспортировке милых роботов с одной точки в другую. На уровне могут быть от одного до восьми роботов. 
Так же в игре представлены ряды механизмов, которые будут или усложнять или облегчать прохождение уровней.
Всего в игре 8 частей, в каждой из которых по 6 уровней. Уровни сами не очень большие, но некоторые попадаются нереально сложные, прохождение которых занимает около 15-20 минут. Но если вы хороши в головоломках, то эта игра не будет для вас тяжелым испытанием.
Управлять роботом вы не можете, он управляется исскуственным интеллектом, а в ваших руках только расположение преград, а это значит что будут возникать дополнительные проблемы с направлением роботов. Иногда он может повернуться совсем в другую сторону, в которую ему не стоило идти. 

[*] В игре нету конкретного сюжета или объяснения того, что происходит. Но на протяжении уровня главный искуственный интеллект, который будет вашим гидом по этим загадкам, будет выдавать смешные фразы и шутки. Это немного разряжает игровую обстановку. Так же в конце вас ждёт неожиданный сюрприз, который разъяснит немного сложившуюся ситуацию.

[*] [b]EXTRA![/b] Так же хочу упомянуть что в игре после прохождения кампании есть приятный бонус ввиде мини-игр со старых приставок. Например вы сможете поиграть в Space Invaders или же Tenis. Это очень радует и даёт нотку ностальгии.

[/list]

Вердикт: [i]Неплохая головоломка за свои деньги. Темболее игру делал один человек и судить игру как долгострой не стоит. [/i]

Оценка: [b]7.8/10[/b]. Хорошая головоломка от одного разработчика.

Обзор был составлен Ci8, членом группы [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/bigbadwhl] BigBadWhale Games[/url] в сотрудничестве с [url=http://welovebundles.ru/]WeLoveBundles[/url]

Ключ к игре предоставил издатель, но это [u]никак не влияет[/u] на моё мнение и оценку.

Оценка редакции:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=706582524

29795912.review:
[h1]Pretty cool, very well done and challenging puzzle game!  What more could you want?[/h1]

The object is to simply get the Red and Blue robots to their Red and Blue respective "X"s.  To accomplish this and guide them down the desired path, you place obstacles in their way knowing that robots always move forward until they hit an obstacle at which point Red robots turn right, and Blue robots turn left.

Throughout the campaign new ideas are introduced such as platforms that raise and lower when a robot crosses them, or one-way "moving sidewalks".

The game is simple, but definitely gets quite challenging.  I was stuck on one level in particular for quite awhile.   That said, the game is still pretty short.  The 45 levels of the campaign I managed to [b]complete in 3.0 hrs[/b] per Steam.  But, to extend the game there is a level-editor and you can download additional levels from the Steam Workshop.

[h1]The PROs:[/h1]
+ Very well done and Polished
+ Nice graphics
+ Simple to pick-up and start playing
+ Levels get very challenging
+ Steam Workshop for additional levels

[h1]The CONs:[/h1]
- Maybe a little short campaign.  But that's all I can think of as a "con" really.

[h1]Overall:  It's a neat little puzzle game and well-worth playing.  8.5 / 10.[/h1]

29423086.review:
Buy this ON-SALE. 

The puzzle mechanics are simple and fun. The game would be worth full price with a lot more levels. It's a 1-day playthrough. Could be a few hours, or it could be a week if you really spread it out. I only have "34 hours on record" because I accidentally fell asleep with the game on.

29361306.review: It took me more than two hours to complete the main campaign but with the steam workshop integration it offers a lot of fun stuff for future experimentations. I had a lot of fun to puzzle through the main story.

29317532.review:
Redirection is a cracking little isometric puzzle game. A glance at the screenshots will tell you all you need to know really. Place objects in the path of robots to guide them home. It's simple and unfussy, with puzzles that are set to just the right difficulty. Many will have you stumped for a while, but none should have you quitting in frustration. And it's been designed to make the player's life easier. For example, you can rewind and tweak solutions without having to start all over again. You can rotate the view or view it top-down. There are no time limits or tedious requirements to play and replay levels over and over again. It's clear that the developer wants you to progress and enjoy each puzzle to the full. I respect that. At the time of writing he's still active on the forum; listening to feedback and making small adjustments. I respect that, too.

Redirection gets a big thumbs-up from me.

27847427.review:
Gameplay: This game has a very decent amount of content with a load of challenging levels you can spend your time on and the fun robot arcade where you are able to play minigames like pong or tetris. The game has essentially an unlimited amount of content as the game can be modded by everyone who owns the game. This includes creating your own robot arcade games, levels, theme songs, textures and storylines.

Performance: The game is quite small in storage size, so no hours of waiting required as the game loads its assets. The graphics are what you would expect from such an arcade game and the game runs beautifully thanks to good optimization.

Bonus: awesome geek references.

9/10 Needs more turtles :3

27275171.review: Redirection is a wonderful puzzle game based on logic and timing. I bought it in early alpha for $5, and have watched as it has progressed into this finished product. The inclusion of a level editor with Steam Workshop allows for much more than the somewhat small amount of prepackaged levels. It does get a bit frustrating when you have to resort to trial and error for timing, and certain functions aren't explained as thuroughly as they could be.

26613294.review: You can create half-adders in this game, without any scripting!

26483037.review:
An incredible puzzle game with gorgeous graphics and amazing Workshop support, Redirection is well worth the money.

An extensive campaign with challenging puzzles delivers hours of playtime in the base game, plus new levels are available through the workshop. The puzzles strike the right balance between difficulty and fun, and with a level editor to create your own, you can never run out of puzzle fun.

On the side, there's also arcade games you can play, which are fun litle time wasters for if you're stuck on a puzzle. Extra arcade games are also available through the workshop.

Overall, the game is a genius combination of puzzles, charm, and extensive customisation capabilities. Definitely recommend.

26466003.review:
I don't really like puzzle games, thinking is hard. But occasionally I find one that I can really enjoy and Redirection really nails it.

The game takes a simple mechanic, some go left, some go right, and perfectly takes that simplicity and makes interesting puzzles that are enjoyable to solve. The solution process in this game is tough but not frusturating so I find myself settling in and thinking as opposed to just getting annoyed with some irksome mechanic.

If you are looking for a relaxing yet challenging puzzle game, you definitely want to pick up Redirection.

26360612.review: Really enjoyed the game. :) A neat puzzler and has some nice twists on the basic concept in the later levels.

26359523.review:
Very nice relaxing puzzle game, by relaxing though I do not mean easy!
The graphics hit the sweetspot between simple and clear while being very pleasing to the eye, the music is nicely made and fits with the puzzle element of the game.
The gameplay follows only a few rules (as of 1.4 hours in), but the puzzles are designed in such a way which means you'll have to think outside of the box to solve some of them. The price is great for the amount of content, which as it has full modding support (no suprise at it was made by the author of a popular minecraft mod: computercraft) will only get better. Will be interesting to see what appears on the workshop.
Take an evening off, put your headphones in and get solving. Suitable accompaniments include some nice cheese & biscuits and a decent botttle of red (or tea).

26359329.review: Ein sehr gutes Puzzle Spiel mit einer tollen Story, nicht super lang, dafür auch nicht so teuer. Ich kann nur empfehlen das Spiel zu kaufen.

26323473.review:

Music is brilliant also!

Buy this game, you wont be disapointed

26297533.review: Really cool puzzle game with nice graphics and music, the 2 I struggled on the most was Trading Places and Suspension.

26297349.review:
Ever played Chu Chu Rocket? If not, you should. Great puzzler. If you have, this is pretty similar, with a couple of minor but significant changes that work really well. The grid-based movement is retained and your gameplay still entirely consists of placing limited obstacles on the level to guide little characters to the exit, but now they can turn in different directions depending on their colour, you can set obstacles to spawn on a timer and now levels are 3 dimensional instead of just being on a flat grid. To me, that alone adds a lot of depth to the gameplay.

The main levels can take around 3-5 hours (played campaign on itch.io version) unless you're a genius, I didn't find it too difficult but I still enjoyed it. There's also a good level editor that lets you string together your own levels as a custom campaign and upload it to the steam workshop (or export to a .zip file in other versions). Given the robust level editor, it's a bit of a shame that the levels in the main campaign didn't go a little further but hey, I've had a blast making weird stuff in the editor so far.

Cute style, mechanically solid and pretty fun all around, Redirection gets a full recommendation from me.

26282364.review:
It's made by Dan200, so of course it's good....
CraftOS 2.0 now pls Dan?

26267560.review:
This game .. is quite well-polished, with the graphic quality and presentation on a rather clean scale. Fundamental mechanics are explained right off the bat, and the text presentation of what must be done in the early puzzles is spot-on.

The game has you operating the ship's teleportation system to beam in obstacles to help robots move to their designations. However, puzzles often call for you to set a delay in teleporting obstacles -- once an obstacle is placed, it cannot be removed.

The nice features of this game involve letting you "rewind" to the start of the puzzle if something's amiss, allowing you to make changes, and try again. And in the case playing your solution takes too long, you can temporarily fast-forward, for as long as you hold that button down.

And in the case you solve all the puzzles, there's Workshop support where you can download others' puzzles -- or upload your own.

Overall, well worth the price. Recommended if you enjoy puzzle games.

(Reviewer's note: the publisher of this game is known for a huge Minecraft mod, "Computercraft", as well as an assisting developer of other mods, including Sven Coop. Don't let this tidbit change your judgement, though.)

26263634.review: Bought it way back when it was first announced. Great game, very enjoyable and has some unique puzzle features that make it interesting and different from other games in the genre.

26246826.review:
Really good game. Played it for around 20 minutes and definitely do not regret the purchase. The idea is original and the style is really good. The only thing to note that if you are stuck on a level, music will get repetetive, but it is understandable for an indie game and the music is not bad at all.

Looks like it includes a level editor and a mod editor, but I have not tried these yet.

26239253.review:
I just bought the game and played the first 6 levels. It's still earlier, but my initial impression is extremely enthusiastic. I absolutely love the art style and play mechanics. As an aspiring game developer myself, I sincerely appreciate the love poured into the design. The inclusion of the mod editor adds extra value to an already fairly priced game.

In conclusion, major kudos to the dev--very impressive!

26233395.review:
The game is a TON of fun.  If you'd like to see what its like, I did a video review here: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GK1Q9ft1p-g

1) The base game has many different puzzles that are all interesting and make you think through a good solution.  Things quickly go from simple to complex as you try to guide these lovable little robots back home.  

2) Everything in the game is moddable! Using a simple in-game level editor you can make your own levels, and if you really want to get complex, you can use scripting and assets (art) to create your own tiles with their own abilities! You can add your own music, textures, cutscenes, and tiles.  

Highly recommend checking it out.

26221000.review:
This is a really nice game! At first glance the levels look easy, but they are challenging! (I'm actually at a pint where I don't have any solutions.) The Story is also good, and the scenario described isn't so unrealistic. The Captain (which is a neat character [spoiler]that likes to play Minecraft[/spoiler]) says they haven't found any aliens ever, which is logical, since there are no signs of anything we could discover. [spoiler] That energy blast might be a negative energy blast, creating random wormholes which collapse after contact with positive energy (robots). Also, there's a nice excuse for the metal structures in the asteroid field, aliens![/spoiler] Just the density of the field is not scientifically accurate, but hey, it might be artificial, but I think Captain...
ummm... was it "Barney"? should have noticed that. But who knows! Maybe they were so far away that they couldn't detect it. I'm excited for the end of the story! (And for the solution of that level I'm stuck at.) Aaand the art is reaaaly nice! Just the rock rendering in the mod editor is... well... needs an update. Sadly there aren't that many workshop files yet, but you can check out my mod, "No rock but steel". Thumbs Up For The Game!

EDIT: Nominated this game for the Steam Awards "Game in Game" Award. It deserves that! The fact of a [spoiler]scriptable arcade game system being available qualifies it.[/spoiler] Pls vote for this game!
(btw, if you edit a review of a game you nominated you get something back, but that's not the only reason I do this=)

EDIT II: There's just one unlogical thing. Why/How do the robots fall down in space? Is there an artificial gravitational field? I think it'd be more realistic (and funnier) if the robots would start floating away.

~?

26219885.review: Deceivingly simple! The first few levels introduce the rules quickly and get you off to a flying start, but there are a few curve balls along the way to keep you on your toes. Currently stuck on the level 'Entanglement', I'm sure there's a clue in the name...

26213023.review: Loved the alpha, nice to see it reach steam

26209261.review: Great little puzzler. Lots of fun!

26208157.review: Overrall a great game. I havent played it much as of writing this review, but I can say already that is is a unique and fun puzzle game with a great viual style and musical appeal.

26208136.review: Excellent game with some fun easter eggs. As always with puzzlers, sometimes you just get stuck and have to come back to a level later. I would recommend this game to anyone who wants a simple puzzle game with a quirky sci-fi story (though robot-only ships are totally the way to go; seriously, why send humans into deadly deadly space when robots can do the job?).

26207833.review:
This is a fun little puzzle game that does make you think.

I've yet to finish it and already can recommend it due to its low price and great quality.

(It also includes an arcade to code your own mini-games in Lua if you want to.)

EDIT: Just decided to nominate this game for the "Game within a Game" award for its robot arcade

26206584.review: Great little puzzler, will keep my Mum entertained for hours :)

26205509.review:
Note I bought the alpha of this game so I've played much longer than steam thinks.

It's a fun game that really makes you think about the puzzles. It's extremely satisfying when you suddenly realise the solution and think, "why didn't I realise that all along!"

I would definitely recommend it, especially at such a low price.

26205332.review:
It's pretty okay. Not great, but okay.
The puzzles are easy. Not trivial, but easy.

If there was a “meh” in between thumbs up and thumbs down, it would get that from me.

Took me around 90 minutes to complete, didn't feel like a waste of time, but didn't feel particularly original either. “Rush” by two tribes have very similar mechanics but make more out of them. But, I admit, cubes are not as cute as robots.

26204681.review:
A casual puzzle game. The name of the game is the game of the game. You need to redirect robots through a maze to get to the goal. Blue robots turn left and (R)ed robots turn (R)ight when encountering an obstacle. There are fixed obstacles in the puzzles but the player places additional ones to redirect the robots.

Graphic style is clean and simple, music is soothing but can get slightly repetative after a while.

All in all the game feels very polished and I have not yet encountered a single bug or issue

The puzzles are not very challenging and there are "only" 45 of them (according to description), but I imagine that they would be perfectly suited for a younger audience. The game does have a level editor and workshop support so I suspect that, given time, there are going to be plenty of puzzles of varying difficulty available there.

Although I may sound negative, I do enjoy the game and I wholeheartedly recomend it

26204602.review: A really funny game and you must think twice bevor you can end the levels.

26204018.review:
Wow. Awesome. Stunning graphics and cool effects.

Keep in mind that you're not just buying one game when you get this. Lovely hidden gems! :D

[spoiler]Create a desktop shortcut for:
redirection.exe -arcade
hat tip to the finder: https://twitter.com/TheWhoAreYouPer/status/790758047178067968[/spoiler]

26203213.review: This game is worth ever cent. It is fun to play and the amount of details is great. Gameplay is fun. The levels are sometimes quite easy and sometimes quite difficult. There is also a map editor and a scripting environment which i find quite interesting if you are into this kind of stuff.

26203194.review: Logical thinking meets timing. Already love it.

26202677.review:
Ho visto come si è evoluto fin dall'alpha, ed è migliorato molto. Nuove grafiche, nuove musiche e meccanica di gioco cambiata. E puoi pure crearti i livelli se vuoi, per poi pubblicarli nel Workshop.

Devo dire altro? Sono una persona di poche parole.

Ah, ho avuto la copia gratis perché ho tradotto il gioco.

26202647.review:
This is a really neat game.
I have only played the first few levels, but the gameplay is fun and the levels progress well.
The art style is fantastic, the robots are cute, and the amount of time put into everything, such as the animation of the robots, really shows.
There is also a built in level editor and scripting environment for more advanced players.
And all for only $8. Fantastic.

39392034.review: Awesome puzzle game with nice difficulty progression! Highly recommended.

39415678.review:
I happened to be a translator of this game, because of how amazing it looked in screenshots I saw.
I received a translation copy for free, this can also explain the lack of hours that I got on steam for this game, as I first downloaded it from itch.io.

I always loved clever puzzles and this one is no exception. The beautiful graphics, the amazing levels, the story, the mechanics and the attention to detail is extraordinary in this game. All of that bundled with the amazing library of levels and addons in the Steam Workshop make for a very complete game at a very low price!

I am happy that I had the chance to play this game and appreciate it as much as I have. Its truly a great game that will challenge your mind in its creative puzzles, so why not give it a try?
